org.modelio.vbasic.net

Class SslManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.modelio.vbasic.net.SslManager

  • public class SslManager
extends Object
    Creates and configure a customized SSLContext to manage https URIs.

    Allows to add temporary or permanently trusted certificates.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static SslManager getInstance()
        Returns:
        the singleton instance.

      • addCertificate

        public void addCertificate(X509Certificate cert,
                           boolean permanent)
                    throws KeyStoreException
        Add a trusted certificate.
        Parameters:
        cert - the certificate to trust
        permanent - true to trust it permanently, false to trust it until the JVM exits.
        Throws:
        KeyStoreException - if the certificate cannot be permanently stored.

      • setTrustStoreFile

        public void setTrustStoreFile(Path trustStoreFile)
                       throws IOException
        Set the file path where permanent trusted certificates are stored.
        Parameters:
        trustStoreFile - the trust store path.
        Throws:
        IOException - in case of failure reading the file.

      • getSslContext

        public SSLContext getSslContext()
        Returns:
        the SSL context to use to create SSL connections

      • fixUntrustedServer

        public boolean fixUntrustedServer(URI uri,
                                  X509Certificate[] certChain,
                                  Throwable error)
        Allow the getUntrustedServerFixer() to fix the trust error.

        Returns false if no trust fixer has been registered.

        If the method returns true the caller may try the connection again.

        Parameters:
        uri - the URI whose connection failed
        certChain - the certificate chain whose validation failed
        error - the SSL connection error
        Returns:
        true if connection can be tried again, false if it should be aborted.

      • fixUntrustedServer

        public boolean fixUntrustedServer(SSLException ex,
                                  URI uri)
        Allow the getUntrustedServerFixer() to fix the trust error.

        Returns false if no trust fixer has been registered.

        If the method returns true the caller may try the connection again.

        Parameters:
        ex - the SSL exception
        uri - the URI whose connection failed
        Returns:
        true if connection can be tried again, false if it should be aborted.

      • getUntrustedServerFixer

        public ISslUntrustedServerFixer getUntrustedServerFixer()
        Returns:
        the SSL non trusted server fixer.

      • setUntrustedServerFixer

        public void setUntrustedServerFixer(ISslUntrustedServerFixer sslTrustProblemFixer)
        Set the handler that can fix non trusted SSL server.
        Parameters:
        sslTrustProblemFixer - the trust fixer.

      • getTrustManager

        public X509TrustManager getTrustManager()
        Get the X509TrustManager configured by this manager.

        This trust manager throws a InvalidCertificateException when a server certificate is not valid.

        Returns:
        the X509TrustManager.
